DragThreshold

Determines the threshold (in web pixels) for triggering a drag. The default is 20.

Declaration

public bool HoveringEnabled
Field Value
Type Description
System.Boolean
Remarks

Important notes:

InitialUrl

If you drag the prefab into the scene via the editor, you can set this property to make it so that the instance automatically loads the given URL after it initializes. To load a new URL at runtime, use IWebView.LoadUrl() instead.

Declaration
[Label("Initial URL (optional)")]
[Tooltip("You can set this to the URL that you want to load, or you can leave it blank if you'd rather add a script to load content programmatically with IWebView.LoadUrl() or LoadHtml().")]
[HideInInspector]
public string InitialUrl
Field Value
Type Description
System.String

WebView

Gets the prefab's IWebView instance. This property is null before the prefab finishes initializing, so please use WaitUntilInitialized() or the Initialized event to detect when the prefab has initialized.

Destroy()

Destroys the instance and its children. Note that you don't have to call this method if you destroy the instance's parent with Object.Destroy().

Declaration
public void Destroy()
Examples
// The webview can no longer be used after it's destroyed.
webViewPrefab.Destroy();

SetOptionsForInitialization(WebViewOptions)

Sets options that can be used to alter the webview that the prefab creates during initialization. This method can only be called prior to when the prefab initializes (i.e. directly after instantiating it or setting it to active).

Declaration
public void SetOptionsForInitialization(WebViewOptions options)
Parameters
Type Name Description
WebViewOptions options

SetPointerInputDetector(IPointerInputDetector)

By default, the prefab detects pointer input events like clicks through Unity's event system, but you can use this method to override the way that input events are detected.

Declaration
public void SetPointerInputDetector(IPointerInputDetector pointerInputDetector)
Parameters
Type Name Description
IPointerInputDetector pointerInputDetector
Examples
var yourCustomInputDetector = webViewPrefab.Collider.AddComponent<YourCustomInputDetector>();
webViewPrefab.SetPointerInputDetector(yourCustomInputDetector);

SetWebViewForInitialization(IWebView)

By default, the prefab creates a new IWebView during initialization. However, you can call this method before the prefab initializes to pass it an existing, initialized IWebView to use instead. This method can only be called prior to when the prefab initializes (i.e. directly after instantiating it or setting it to active).

Declaration
public void SetWebViewForInitialization(IWebView webView)
Parameters
Type Name Description
IWebView webView

Events

Clicked

Indicates that the prefab was clicked. Note that the prefab automatically calls IWebView.Click() for you.

Declaration
public virtual event EventHandler<ClickedEventArgs> Clicked
Event Type
Type Description
System.EventHandler<ClickedEventArgs>
Remarks

This event is not supported when running in Native 2D Mode.

Examples
webViewPrefab.Clicked += (sender, eventArgs) => {
    Debug.Log("WebViewPrefab was clicked at point: " + eventArgs.Point);
};

Initialized

Indicates that the prefab finished initializing, so its WebView property is ready to use.

Declaration
public event EventHandler Initialized
Event Type
Type Description
System.EventHandler

Scrolled

Indicates that the prefab was scrolled. Note that the prefab automatically calls IWebView.Scroll() for you.

Declaration
public virtual event EventHandler<ScrolledEventArgs> Scrolled
Event Type
Type Description
System.EventHandler<ScrolledEventArgs>
Remarks

This event is not supported when running in Native 2D Mode.

Examples

webViewPrefab.Scrolled += (sender, eventArgs) => { Debug.Log($"WebViewPrefab was scrolled. Point: {eventArgs.Point}, scroll delta: {eventArgs.ScrollDelta}"); };
